title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 September 2013 - XWiki
content:
<polx> has quit  
03:16 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
03:19 <sburjan`> has quit  
03:19 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
07:02 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:36 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
07:37 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:38 <evalica> has quit  
07:39 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:06 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
08:07 <cjd> has quit  
08:44 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
08:44 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:55 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <vmassol> good morning  
09:53 <vmassol> last day before the M2 release! :)  
09:53 <vmassol> mflorea: any status for us re the search suggest? will you be able to commit today?  
09:55 <vmassol> and lots of failing jobs :(  
10:06 <mflorea> vmassol: I'm almost done, but I have a hard time converting the workspace search suggest service to solr, precisely writing a Solr query to select workspaces that match user input. I'm going trial and error since I'm not a master of the Lucene/Solr query syntax. I have a backup solution but I want to try some more maybe I find a better one  
10:06 <vmassol> ok  
10:10 <mflorea> vmassol: regarding failing jobs, there is not much time left for me to look for a selenium workaround so I guess it's safer to revert the selenium upgrade (and the FF upgrade on CI agents). I can try to fix it after M2 release, for RC1.  
10:11 <vmassol> yes ok  
10:11 <mflorea> last time I checked most of the tests failures were due to selenium upgrade  
10:12 <mflorea> I'll revert the upgrade after I finish with search suggest  
10:16 <cjd> has joined #xwiki

11:22 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
11:52 <fmancinelli> I have a quick Maven question. I would like to get the standard XE WAR, add some stuff to it, modify its web.xml and repackage it. Merging web.xml apparently doesn't work. Should I take the extract-web.xml-apply-XSL-transformation-copy-repackage path or is there something that doesn't complicate too much the pom.xml?  
12:11 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
12:24 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
12:36 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
12:39 <vmassol> has quit  
13:06 <fmancinelli> has quit  
13:11 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
13:20 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
14:27 <mflorea> has quit  
14:35 <vmassol1> ok I've implemented a js-based counter (auto-refreshing) to display active installs stas :)  
14:35 <vmassol1> \*stats  
14:35 <vmassol1> see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9401#  
14:35 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
14:36 <vmassol> I'm sure I've made lots of mistakes and I'll need some js expert to review my code which I'm 100% sure can be improved ;)  
14:36 <vmassol> (no hurry though)  
15:19 <fmancinelli> has quit  
15:32 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
15:38 <evalica> has quit  
15:39 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
16:02 <sburjan> Hello. Does anyone know if we introduced recently some mechanism to register a listener automatically at XWiki startup without having to defin a scheduler job ? I don't know but I remember vaguely that we did that

17:34 <fmancinelli> (Retry) I have a quick Maven question. I would like to get the standard XE WAR, add some stuff to it, modify its web.xml and repackage it. Merging web.xml apparently doesn't work. Should I take the extract-web.xml-apply-XSL-transformation-copy-repackage path or is there something that doesn't complicate too much the pom.xml?  
17:38 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:40 <camil7> I have to admit I only used the overlay stuff  
17:40 <vmassol> for merging web.xml I had coded a webxmlmerge ant task a long time ago  
17:40 <vmassol> http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/integration/ant/task\_webxmlmerge.html  
17:40 <camil7> ah, ant to the rescue :)  
17:41 <vmassol> hmm I think I also coded a maven plugin  
17:41 <vmassol> on cargo  
17:41 <vmassol> http://cargo.codehaus.org/Merging+WAR+files  
17:41 <camil7> well, if necessary one can call ant from maven ...  
17:42 <camil7> ah, I am slightly behind I see  
17:43 <vmassol> best is to move to servlet 3.0  
17:43 <vmassol> :)  
17:43 <fmancinelli> :)  
17:43 <fmancinelli> thanks  
17:43 <fmancinelli> looking at the ant or cargo plugin  
17:44 <vmassol> disclaimer: I haven't touched the cargo code for the past 9 years or so :)  
17:44 <vmassol> gtg bfn  
17:45 <vmassol> has quit  
18:09 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
18:24 <fmancinelli> actually the CARGO plugin seems to work fine :) Cool  
18:33 <gdelhumeau> good bye!
